div.p: Querying and Updating Probabilistic Information in XML
Pierre Senellart (INRIA Futurs) Fuzzy XML EDBT 06 1 / 19
Many tasks generate imprecise data, with some confidence value:
Information Extraction Natural Language Processing Data Cleaning Schema Matching . . .
Need for a way to manage this imprecision, to work with it throughout an entire complex process.

Queries: Tree-Pattern With Join (TPWJ) (standard subset of XQuery)
Join: by value Result: minimal subtree containing all the nodes mapped by the query

Update Transaction: TPWJ query + mapping, stating where to perform operations.

Pierre Senellart (INRIA Futurs) Fuzzy XML EDBT 06 8 / 19
Semantic foundation for probabilistic data: possible worlds model. Set of tree/probability pairs, one for each possible world.
Pierre Senellart (INRIA Futurs) Fuzzy XML EDBT 06 9 / 19
Semantic foundation for probabilistic data: possible worlds model. Set of tree/probability pairs, one for each possible world.
Pierre Senellart (INRIA Futurs) Fuzzy XML EDBT 06 9 / 19
Definition If T = {(ti, pi )}, the result of query Q over the Possible Worlds set T is the normalization of {(t, pi )|t Q(ti )}
Definition The result of an update t with confidence c on a Possible Worlds set T is the normalization of:
{(t, p) T | t is not selected by Q} {((t), p c) | t is selected by Q} {(t, p (1 c)) | t is selected by Q}
Pierre Senellart (INRIA Futurs) Fuzzy XML EDBT 06 10 / 19
Definition If T = {(ti, pi )}, the result of query Q over the Possible Worlds set T is the normalization of {(t, pi )|t Q(ti )}
Definition The result of an update t with confidence c on a Possible Worlds set T is the normalization of:
{(t, p) T | t is not selected by Q} {((t), p c) | t is selected by Q} {(t, p (1 c)) | t is selected by Q}
Pierre Senellart (INRIA Futurs) Fuzzy XML EDBT 06 10 / 19
Pierre Senellart (INRIA Futurs) Fuzzy XML EDBT 06 11 / 19
Fuzzy Tree Model Model and Possible Worlds Semantics
Data tree with event conditions (conjunction of probabilistic events or negations of probabilistic events) assigned to each node.
Theorem The fuzzy tree model is as expressive as the Possible Worlds model.
Pierre Senellart (INRIA Futurs) Fuzzy XML EDBT 06 12 / 19
Fuzzy Tree Model Model and Possible Worlds Semantics
Data tree with event conditions (conjunction of probabilistic events or negations of probabilistic events) assigned to each node.
Theorem The fuzzy tree model is as expressive as the Possible Worlds model.
Pierre Senellart (INRIA Futurs) Fuzzy XML EDBT 06 12 / 19
Fuzzy Tree Model Model and Possible Worlds Semantics
Data tree with event conditions (conjunction of probabilistic events or negations of probabilistic events) assigned to each node.
Theorem The fuzzy tree model is as expressive as the Possible Worlds model.
Pierre Senellart (INRIA Futurs) Fuzzy XML EDBT 06 12 / 19
Query on underlying tree. Probabilities: probability of the conjunction of the conditions of nodes of the mapping.
Pierre Senellart (INRIA Futurs) Fuzzy XML EDBT 06 13 / 19
Query on underlying tree. Probabilities: probability of the conjunction of the conditions of nodes of the mapping.
Pierre Senellart (INRIA Futurs) Fuzzy XML EDBT 06 13 / 19
Insertions: no problem. Conditions required for the query to match added to inserted nodes.
Deletions: ok, but more problematic. May yield an exponential growth of the fuzzy tree in case of complex dependencies.
Pierre Senellart (INRIA Futurs) Fuzzy XML EDBT 06 14 / 19

Insertions: no problem. Conditions required for the query to match added to inserted nodes. Deletions: ok, but more problematic. May yield an exponential growth of the fuzzy tree in case of complex dependencies.

A model for representing probabilistic information for semi-structured data.

Sound and complete support for an important subset of XQuery. Sound and complete support for XUpdate-based transactions with inserts and deletes. An implementation based on compilation to XQuery/XUpdate.
Pierre Senellart (INRIA Futurs) Fuzzy XML EDBT 06 18 / 19
A model for representing probabilistic information for semi-structured data. Sound and complete support for an important subset of XQuery.
Sound and complete support for XUpdate-based transactions with inserts and deletes. An implementation based on compilation to XQuery/XUpdate.
Pierre Senellart (INRIA Futurs) Fuzzy XML EDBT 06 18 / 19

A model for representing probabilistic information for semi-structured data. Sound and complete support for an important subset of XQuery. Sound and complete support for XUpdate-based transactions with inserts and deletes.
An implementation based on compilation to XQuery/XUpdate.

A model for representing probabilistic information for semi-structured data. Sound and complete support for an important subset of XQuery. Sound and complete support for XUpdate-based transactions with inserts and deletes. An implementation based on compilation to XQuery/XUpdate.

Query optimization. Fuzzy data simplification. Extensions: negation, some limited order.
